About

After exploring a couple of different industries and career pathways, I finally bit the bullet in January 2021 and decided to go after my passion of website development; all guns blazing.

Fast forward to a year later – I’ve learned SO much, yet my interest in learning the tools of the trade has grown even stronger. I’m hungry to provide solutions for people with my code.

I see website development as the best of both worlds… Applying technical knowledge with out-of-the-box thinking and creativity.

My dream now is to find my forever home: A culture-driven Brisbane-based company that allows me to utilise my skills and solve problems for clients.

A few technologies I know well:

  • HTML
  • CSS
  • Tailwind CSS
  • JavaScript
  • React
  • PHP
  • MySQL
  • Wordpress

I’m currently working on improving my knowledge of:

  • Node.js
  • Typescript
  • Laravel

Projects

Wildlife Watcher

A labour of love, I made this app to fulfill a wish I had to keep track of the wildlife in my local area.

I wanted to create the entire project with vanilla JavaScript and PHP to ensure I had a depth of knowledge before moving on to learn any frameworks.

Personal highlights: Utilisation of database indexes to categorise content per animal type, species or name. Longitude and latitude recognition for Google Maps API. Components made from scratch

  • JavaScript
  • Google Maps API
  • Tailwind CSS
  • Image handling
  • REST API
  • PHP
  • MySQL

PHEM - Mechatronics Engineering

During my studies at TAFE, a class-wide competition took place to create a Wordpress website for a clients’ mechatronics business.

After my pitch, thankfully the client chose my creation the website he would use moving forward.

Personal highlights: Deep research on industry specific requirements and competitor websites. Providing a client with my product to support their business

  • Wordpress
  • Customised PHP theme
  • ??
